The Rules
Stolen and modified from GuyInFreezer

General Rules

  1. Follow the Site-wide rules.
  2. I make mistakes. If I do, please PM me unless it is a VC mistake (in which you can bold in thread).
  3. Do not lie to the mod.
  4. If you have a question for me, you can PM me. If you need to talk to me in thread, please bold your question.
  5. Do not use hidden or encrypted text. Text size below 75 (small) is counted as hidden text.
  6. If you can edit/delete your posts, don't do it.
  7. Be nice, swear words are fine, but use of homophobic/sexist/racial/etc. slurs are not allowed.
  8. Do not discuss any ongoing games and do not discuss this game anywhere else.
  9. Do not quote or screen-capture any communication with me, including your role PM. Paraphrasing is okay. If you are not sure about it, contact me.
  10. Do not attempt to analyze your role PM (such as asking "what time did you receive your role PM?")
  11. Do not use provable randomization in this game. Saying that you rolled a dice is fine, using dice tags are not.
  12. Bolded Red (#FF0000) is my color. Don't use it or anything close to it.
  13. If I think you're breaking the rules, you're breaking the rules. Don't pretend, I will count it as breaking the rules.
  14. If you break these rules, I have full rights to punish you at my will. This can range from simple warning to modkill/force-replace.
  15. I can change or add to these rules at any time. If I do so, I will state it in the thread.

Voting and Lynching:

  1. Only votes by using bold or vote tags will be counted such as Vote: Flames682 or VOTE: Flames682.
    To do this, type [b]Vote: Flames682[/b] or [v]Flames682[/v].
  2. All votes must have a colon after them, otherwise they will not be counted.
  3. Unvotes are helpful, but not required.
  4. If I think it's a vote, then it's a vote.
  5. Lynch happens when half of players + 1 vote the same person rounded down.
  6. If a majority is reached, any more votes or unvotes will not matter anymore and the player is lynched.
  7. Players may talk in twilight before I lock the thread.
  8. If the deadline is over and there is no majority, there is a No Lynch.
  9. If you died someway other than being lynched, you may post one information-less "bah" post.

Activity and Deadline:

  1. Deadline for each day is 14 days.
  2. Night deadline is 2 days.
  3. If you're on V/LA (Vacation/Limited Access), please tell me by either posting it in thread (bolded) or PMing your V/LA to me.
  4. Players will have 24 hours after their V/LA ends to post before I prod them.
  5. If you don't post here for 48 real hours, I will prod you. Failure to post in thread after receiving the prod within 24 hours or receiving 3 prods in 1 in-game day will cause force replacement.
  6. If I have to extend the deadline, I will. If I do, I will post it on thread.






Sample Vanilla Townie role:

Welcome to Mini 1642, Flames682! You are a Vanilla Townie


Abilities:
  • During the day, you can vote and talk
  • You have no abilities at night

Win condition:
You win when all threats to the town are eliminated.

Game thread is here. Confirm by replying to this PM with your role name.

12/13 have confirmed. Day 1 begins now.

In post 1986, MonkeyMan576 wrote:
wiki wrote:Lynch All Liars is a longstanding mantra in the mafiascum.net community. Quite simply, most Townies have no reason to lie about their actions, motivations, or roles. Many newish Townies will attempt to lie in attempts to gambit, and fail miserably by hurting the Town in the process.


The problem here is ignoring the basis for Lynch All Liars.

In many cases if someone is lying, one of two things are happening

1. Someone is lying for a reason that can't be discerned as town motivated, i.e. they are scum.
2. Some newbie is lying as part of a gambit when they didn't really know what they were doing, and because of it town was hurt by the play.

In the first case, lynching the player makes sense as they are likely scum. In the latter case, the player is either lying scum or a newbie town who needs to be lynched for the sake of town, and as a sort of punishment for doing dumb things so they don't do it in the future.

This scenario does not fit into this mantra. Cheeto was damn near confirmed town, and bluffed ever so slightly about his actual role so that he could avoid a nightkill. This is literally the exact opposite of the two above points. His lying is for a town motivated reason, and he is not a newbie and he does know what he is doing, and town was AIDED by the play. He got a confirmed town instead of possibly dying.

I don't want to beat a dead horse or anything, and I'm not going to harangue you over your play. Just in the future, consider that town players can lie for good reasons, and policy lynches aren't exactly an ideal that you need to strive for.

Any way, I feel like the atmosphere in this thread is getting a bit....bleh. Can we give constructive criticisms instead of just insulting people? I'm not happy with the way things turned out either but being a dick to each other isn't going to help anyone's games in the future, nor is it going to exactly endear us to each other
